plugins.name: Optimize Images for Web
plugins.description:
Optimize Images for Web streamlines your entire image export workflow:


  1. Batch-optimize & export: Process every image on a page at once, then download them as a ZIP.
  2. Global compression & resize: Dial in a single set of quality and dimension settings that apply to all assets.
  3. Flexible formats: Choose PNG, WebP, or JPEG output to suit any platform or use case.
  4. Consistent renaming: Automatically rename exports in kebab-case or snake_case for tidy, predictable filenames.


With just a few clicks, you’ll have web-ready images — optimized, resized, correctly named, and packaged — without ever leaving Figma.
plugins.tagline: Batch-optimize, compress, rename, and export web-ready images (webp).

plugins.name: Pigment Pilot
plugins.description:
Pigment Pilot is your all-in-one color inspiration companion for Figma. Extract beautiful color palettes from any image, explore millions of curated photos from Unsplash (Soon from Pinterest), and manage your color schemes effortlessly. Perfect for designers who want to create harmonious color combinations from visual inspiration.


🎺 With the new apply feature, see how an extracted color palette would look in real life by applying it on any SVG type image (illustrations, logos etc)


Key Features

🎨 Extract 8-color palettes from any image

🔍 Search and import Unsplash photos directly

💾 Save and organize your favorite palettes

🎯 Create Figma Color Styles instantly

🎭 Generate CSS variables for development

👕 See how your extracted colors would look when used in real designs with "Apply" feature.


Whether you're designing a website, creating a brand identity, or looking for fresh color inspiration, Pigment Pilot helps you build professional color schemes in seconds. Simply select an image, click extract, and watch as it generates a perfectly balanced palette ready for your next design.
plugins.tagline: Pick, Click, Color Magic.

130377.release_notes:
🎺 The Brand New Apply Tab 🎺

Transform your illustrations with saved color palettes in just a few steps:

1. Select Your Illustration  – Select any frame containing your SVG illustration (Works best with vector illustrations using solid colors) 
2. Choose a Palette – Navigate to the "Apply" tab -> Browse through your saved color palettes -> Click on a palette card to select it.
3. Generate Preview – Click "Generate Assets" to see a preview and you'll get:
[ Original illustration (left) : Transformed illustration (right) ] alongwith a color mapping legend showing the color transformations
4. Review and Iterate – Compare the original and transformed versions side by side, Check the color mapping legend to see how colors were mapped. Try different palettes until you find the perfect match

💡 Pro Tips:
The plugin intelligently maps colors while maintaining visual hierarchy
More vibrant palettes will result in more striking transformations
Works with any number of colors in your illustration
Perfect for creating theme variations of your illustrations

Note: The transformed illustration is created as a new frame, keeping your original artwork untouched.

plugins.name: Text Calculator
plugins.description:
Text Calculator allows Figma users to perform mathematical operations directly within text layers.


The plugin keeps the text layer's original styles intact, including fonts and applied text styles.


To use, simply select a text layer, type your formula (e.g., 5+5), and click the "Calculate" button.


Perfect for designers needing quick calculations while maintaining design consistency.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly perform calculations in text layers.

115128.name: Text Calculator
115128.description:

The plugin keeps the text layer's original styles intact, including fonts and applied text styles.


To use, simply select a text layer, type your formula (e.g., 5+5), and click the "Calculate" button.


Perfect for designers needing quick calculations while maintaining design consistency.
115128.tagline: Effortlessly perform calculations in text layers.

plugins.name: GradCover
plugins.description:
"Cover Gradient Pro is a Figma plugin crafted specifically for users looking to enhance their design documents with eye-catching gradient covers. Whether it's for branding manuals, product catalogs, or personal portfolios, this plugin assists in swiftly creating professional and visually striking cover designs.


With Cover Gradient Pro, you can expect:


A rich palette of gradient options to diversify your cover design choices.

One-click cover generation to streamline the design process and save valuable time.

Highly customizable gradient features, allowing you to adjust colors and effects to fit your design needs.

Seamless integration with Figma, ensuring your cover designs blend perfectly with your project documents.

To use Cover Gradient Pro, simply select the elements you wish to apply a gradient to, and use the plugin's intuitive controls to choose and adjust your preferred gradient for your cover. Transform your designs with the power of Cover Gradient Pro and give your work the standout cover it deserves."

accepted.name: walden
accepted.description: A UX designer full of whimsical ideas.

plugins.tagline: "Cover Gradient Pro - Add Professional Covers to Your Designs"

plugins.name: Apply variable modes to all pages
plugins.description:
Apply your current page variable modes to all pages of your file!

Perfect for designers and teams working with design tokens, themes, or variable-based workflows.


How to use

1 - Go to a page (or create one) that has the desired variable modes applied

2 - Click "Apply this to all pages" / "Remove modes from all pages"


Done! You have easily copied the variable modes applied to your current page and apply them to all pages in your file with a single click.
plugins.tagline: Apply your current page variable modes to all pages of your file!

plugins.name: MultiSelect Plus
plugins.description:
MultiSelect Plus helps you select multiple layers faster and easier than ever before.


Key Features:

• Select multiple layers as search criteria

• Find matching layers across your entire document

• Support for all layer types including shapes, components, and text


Perfect for designers working with:

• Repetitive element structures

• Batch updates and modifications

• Design file cleanup and organization


How to Use:

1. Select any layer on your canvas

2. Add more Layers to use it as your search criteria

3. Click "Find & Select" to highlight all matching layers

4. Use the history panel to quickly reuse


Boost your workflow efficiency by selecting exactly what you need in seconds!
plugins.tagline: Do something that goes beyond "selecting matching layers”

plugins.name: Companion
plugins.description:
Advanced Color Finder [PRO Feature]

A powerful tool that allows you to search for colors across your files.

  1. Ultra-fast search algorithm with advanced labeling
  2. Colors are grouped by type (variable or style) and by source (Remote or local libraries)
  3. Ability to search by variable name, color hex and by layer name
  4. Display number of matching results per color
  5. Select all or individual layers that matches the selected color


Style Guide Generator [Free]

  1. Transform your color collections into a beautiful style guide
  2. Choose one or more color formats to display (HEX, RGB, HSL)
  3. Support for cross-collections linked variables


Contrast Checker [Free]

  1. Check for AA and AAA level compliance
  2. Interactive and instant results when adjusting colors
  3. Live preview and swap foreground and background colors
  4. Get results for for text (Small / Large) and graphics elements


Tints & Shades Generator [Free]

  1. Interactive generator with live colors preview
  2. Ability to customize the number of generated colors
  3. Built-in contrast checker
  4. Preview generated colors on canvas
  5. Save generated colors to variables


Color Converter [Free]

  1. Convert any given color to popular color formats
  2. Currently supports HEX, RGB, HSL, CMYK, HSV, OKLCH and LAB
  3. Select and copy results


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


Sort Layers [Free]

A set of different ways to sort your layers within Figma.

  1. Alphabetical sorting (A-Z or Z-A)
  2. Sort by X or Y position on the canvas
  3. Sort by layer type (Frame, text, group, section, etc…)
  4. Reverse current sorting
  5. Magically sort everything based on names and positions


Distribute Layers [Free]

A powered up version of Figma’s built-in distribute feature.

  1. Distribute selected layers horizontally or vertically
  2. Set a desired value for the space between layers
  3. Ability to align layers from top (in horizontal mode) or left (in vertical mode)


Display As Grid [Free]

Quickly rearrange selected layers in a grid layout with improved alignment and sorting features

  1. Ability to choose the number of columns along with vertical and horizontal gaps
  2. Ability to align columns vertically or not
  3. Extra sorting capabilities for better organization


Hidden Layers [PRO Feature]

Simple yet powerful tool to bulk manage hidden layers. It allows you to

  1. Hide selected layers
  2. Show all hidden layers within a page or within a selection
  3. Select all hidden layers within a page or within a selection
  4. Delete all hidden layers within a page or within a selection


Locked Layers [Free]

Simple yet powerful tool to bulk manage locked layers. It allows you to

  1. Lock or unlock selected layers
  2. Lock or unlock all layers on a page


Remove Numbers [PRO Feature]

Get rid of all those annoying numbers that Figma automatically generates. A single click gets the job done


Ungroup Single Layers Group [PRO Feature]

Optimize your files by ungrouping single layers group or deleting empty groups


Start at 0, 0 [PRO Feature]

It’s just the cherry on top. A file is never tidy unless you start at 0, 0 — and for that, we got you covered


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


Deep Search [PRO Feature]

Deep Search is a unique and ultra-fast way to find any layer within your file, in a simple yet powerful search tool. The search algorithm has been thoroughly optimized for speed, especially for large files.


Below is how it works:

  1. Start by selecting the layer type (Frame, text, rectangle, etc.) or choose “All Layers” to search everything
  2. Choose one or more properties to search for (Fill color, width, font, opacity and many many more). You can also use the Quick Search box to search for any property from the list for easier access
  3. Hit the search button and voilà. Results are there.
  4. Browse the list of matching search results, with ability to filter by layer name.
  5. Click on a result to view it on the canvas or click “Select All” to bulk select all matching results


Here are some example scenarios:

  1. [Simple] ― Find all text layers with the font “Inter” and font weight “Semi Bold”
  2. [Simple] ― Find all rectangles with a corner radius of 16 and corner smoothing of 60%
  3. [Medium] ― Find all instances of a component named “Button” that are hidden and have been detached
  4. [Medium] ― Find all auto layouts that have a minimum width of at least 393px
  5. [Advanced] ― Find all instances of an external library component named “Input” that are marked as ready for dev and whose top left corner radius is less than or equal to 20px
  6. [Advanced] ― Find all layers that have a hidden stroke, have a blend mode applied and whose name include the characters “es”


In short, the possibilities are endless


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


MagiConnect [PRO Feature]

MagiConnect is a simple and easy to use tool that allows you to draw connectors between your frames


Here are some key features:

  1. Auto-draw mode: When enabled, it allows you to quickly draw connectors between any two elements you select on the canvas. The direction of the connector arrow is based on the selection order
  2. Manual mode was designed to give you more flexibility in accessing nested layers before drawing a connector. It’s slower for sure, but gives you more control
  3. You can customize the connector by adjusting the color, opacity, stroke width, radius and stroke style
  4. If you’re not happy with the connector customizations, you can always reset all values to their default state from the manage menu
  5. You can also add an optional description to annotate the connector
  6. The tool will always remember your last used settings whenever it’s launched the next time.
  7. You can update specific connectors within a selection or update globally across a page
  8. In cases where a fresh start is the way to go, simple go to “Manage” and select “Remove all connectors”. This will delete all connectors you’ve added on this page


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


When you purchase the license, you will get a lifetime unlimited access to the plugin, and all to the upcoming features that i’m planning to add. Some really exciting features are coming soon. This is truly the beginning.


Due to limitations from Figma, you can only access PRO features from the account you purchased the license on. You will not be able to access PRO features from connected accounts and must purchase the license again if you want to use it on another account.


Future releases of the plugin might not be at the current price tag.


If you made it this far, I salute you for your patience.


For any questions, ideas, bugs or complaints, I would love to hear from you. Please feel free to reach out.


Built with ❤️
plugins.tagline: The all-in-one plugin you never knew you needed

plugins.name: Hunch - Figma export for Hunch Creative Studio
plugins.description:
It is used to export Figma frames to Hunch Studio templates. By export you can expect .zip file with JSON data & all images used in the design.


It is primarily used by Hunch clients whose designers are working in Figma so they do not need to recreate a design in Hunch Studio while trying to scale the production and variants.

For more info visit:

www.hunchads.com

plugins.name: FigVar - Generate Multiple Variables Instantly
plugins.description:
Welcome to creating variables supaa fast!


Say goodbye to repetitive tasks and manual adjustments. With our plugin, you can create variables effortlessly across your designs, saving valuable time and effort. Focus on the creative aspects of your work while we handle the tedious parts.


How to Use:

  1. Run the Plugin
  2. Select Between Color Variables and Number Variables
  3. Provide a Base Color or Number
  4. Add a Collection Name (Optional)
  5. Add to an Existing Collection (Optional)
  6. Save as Variable (Optional) – If unchecked, it will be saved as a color style
  7. Group Name (Optional)


Need help? I've written a dedicated guide addressing the most frequently asked questions↗ about the plugin. Please have a read before adding comments to the plugin page.
plugins.tagline: Generate multiple color and number variables in one click

plugins.name: Nalipka
plugins.description:
Nalipka is a simple and playful plugin designed to quickly turn any element into a sticker.

Perfect for brainstorms, workshops, notes, visual highlights — or just for fun.


How it works:


  1. Select one or more elements
  2. Open the Nalipka plugin
  3. Click the Create Sticker button
  4. The selected elements will:
  5. Get a white stroke
  6. Soft shadow
  7. 2px rounded corners
  8. Text will be auto-flattened to vector


Key features:


✦ Supports multiple selected objects


✦ Automatically converts text to vector


✦ Preserves original position


✦ Adds white stroke, shadow, and rounded corners — like a real sticker


✦ Clean and minimal UI
plugins.tagline: Make anything look like a sticker. Select → Click → Done.

plugins.name: Any Variables Import (变量导入)
plugins.description:
You don't need to prepare or clean the variables from unnecessary symbols; simply copy the code as it is, and the plugin will automatically find and import all the variables


Key Features:

• Universal Import: Supports colors, numbers, strings, and booleans

• Flexible Collections: Create new variable sets or update existing ones

• Includes support for variable modes

• Wide Compatibility: Works with CSS, LESS, and SASS syntax

• Comprehensive Color Format Support:

Standard formats: HEX, RGB/RGBA, HSL/HSLA, HSB/HSBA

Modern formats: HWB, LCH, LAB, Display-P3

• Intuitive Interface: Includes clear examples for all variable types

• Real-Time Feedback: Visual progress tracking and detailed import summary

• Supports Chinese and Spanish languages.


Note: Currently, the plugin copies values from referenced variables rather than creating actual variable references in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Easily import CSS, LESS, SASS variables into Figma—colors, numbers, strings, and booleans.

plugins.name: Rename Code Syntax (Web/iOS/Android)
plugins.description:
Convert Figma variables to developer-ready code syntax in one click!


Features


🚀 Platform-specific outputs:


  1. Web: var(--color-primary) (CSS)
  2. iOS: colorPrimary (Swift)
  3. Android: color_primary (Kotlin/XML)


🔧 Customization:


  1. Add prefixes like color- or btn-
  2. Choose word dividers (-, _, or custom)
  3. Override default formats (kebab/camel/snake case)


🛠️ Smart formatting:


  1. Handles spaces and special characters (e.g., /)
  2. Works across variable collections
  3. Dark/light mode support


Why developers and designers love it:


  1. Saves hours of manual renaming
  2. Ensures naming consistency across platforms
  3. Perfect for design system maintenance


Usage Instructions


1- Select a variable collection

2- Choose your target platform (Web/iOS/Android)

3- Customize formatting (optional):

  1. Prefix: Add a prefix like color-
  2. Divider: Replace spaces// with -, _, etc.
  3. Format: Override default platform formats

4- Click "Update Variables" – done!


Support & Feedback

"Found a bug? Have feature requests? Reach out at gmazzo@gmail.com


Privacy Notes

"This plugin does NOT collect user data or connect to external servers."
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma variables to developer-ready code syntax in one click!

plugins.name: Shopdev: Figma to Shopify Liquid
plugins.description:
Figma to Shopify Liquid

Turn any Figma design into responsive Liquid code that’s ready to publish to your Shopify theme with the Shopdev Figma plugin. Select your frame in Figma, import it into Shopdev, and deploy in a few clicks, no coding required.


How it works

  1. Open the plugin: Launch the plugin directly within your Figma design file.
  2. Select the frame: Choose any frame, like a hero, banner, testimonial, or promo section.
  3. Click “Import frame”: The plugin automatically transfers your selected design to shopdev.ai.
  4. Customize prompt (Optional): You’ll see a pre-filled prompt “Build this Figma import”; you have the option to add extra input if desired (e.g., "Use a slider for the images on mobile").
  5. Submit the prompt: Shopdev will generate responsive Liquid code you can preview.
  6. Edit and iterate: Continue prompting shopdev to refine your design until it’s perfect.
  7. Publish: Click to deploy directly to your Shopify theme.


Support

For additional support using this plugin, ask questions in the Shopdev Discord channel.


Tips for best results: Use Auto Layout

Auto Layout isn’t required, but it helps the AI better understand your design’s structure and spacing. Using it can lead to more accurate imports with less additional prompting needed, especially for responsive layouts.


From Figma to Shopify with the help of Shopdev, an AI Shopify developer

With the Shopdev Figma plugin, you can convert any static Figma design into live, editable Shopify theme sections, ideal for:

  1. Homepage sections like banners, product features, testimonials, or value props
  2. Landing page sections that can be reused across multiple campaigns
  3. PDP add-ons like trust badges, comparison charts, or upsell modules
  4. Reusable content blocks that can be dragged and dropped across templates
  5. Custom sections for any part of your store without needing a developer


Shopdev automatically interprets your Figma design and generates responsive Liquid code that works natively within Shopify’s theme system. You can edit the output manually or continue refining it through prompts.
plugins.tagline: Use AI to turn any Figma design into Shopify-ready Liquid code

plugins.name: Universal Design (beta)
plugins.description:
UDML Exporter for Figma (beta)


Transform your Figma designs into AI-ready UDML (Universal Design Markup Language) documents. UDML Exporter creates structured, semantic descriptions of your designs specifically optimized for AI interpretation and code generation.


AI-First Design Documentation


UDML is built from the ground up to be understood by AI. Instead of trying to directly convert designs to code (which often produces messy, unmaintainable results), UDML provides AI agents with:


  1. Semantic Structure: Clear representation of layout hierarchies and relationships
  2. Design Context: Comprehensive documentation of components and their usage
  3. Style System: Organized design tokens and variables
  4. Asset Catalog: Structured references to exported graphics and icons
  5. Rich Metadata: Layer names, descriptions, and relationships that AI can interpret


Why AI + UDML?


Traditional Figma-to-code tools try to guess what components you meant to create. UDML takes a different approach:


  1. Let AI Do the Heavy Lifting: Instead of making assumptions, provide AI with rich context
  2. Semantic Understanding: AI can interpret layer names and relationships to generate appropriate components
  3. Design System Integration: AI can map your design tokens to existing system variables
  4. Framework Flexibility: Generate code for any framework or library
  5. Open and Extensible: No locked-in formats or proprietary solutions


How It Works


  1. Design in Figma using Auto Layout and components
  2. Export to UDML (optimized for AI consumption)
  3. Provide the UDML to an AI agent (like Claude or Cursor)
  4. Get clean, semantic code that matches your design system


Example AI Interpretation


<!-- UDML Export -->
<column name="user-profile-card" gap="16px">
<image name="avatar" src="assets/user-avatar.png"/>
<text name="user-name" typography="heading-medium">John Doe</text>
<text name="user-title" typography="body-regular">Senior Designer</text>
</column>


AI might interpret this as:


<!-- React Interpretation -->
<UserCard>
<Avatar src={user.avatar} />
<Heading level={3}>{user.name}</Heading>
<Text>{user.title}</Text>
</UserCard>


Perfect For


  1. Designers who want AI to understand their work
  2. Developers who need intelligent code generation
  3. Teams building or maintaining design systems
  4. Anyone looking for an alternative to traditional Figma-to-code tools


Getting Started


  1. Install the plugin
  2. Design with AI interpretation in mind
  3. Export to UDML
  4. Let AI generate your code


Design for AI


To get the best results:

  1. Use clear, descriptive layer names
  2. Leverage Auto Layout for clear structure
  3. Create consistent component patterns
  4. Document your design system tokens


Join the AI-First Design Movement


UDML is an open specification for AI-friendly design documentation. Help shape the future of AI-assisted design-to-code workflows.


docs.universaldesign.ai
plugins.tagline: Figma to code, your way

plugins.name: Icon Stitch
plugins.description:
Icon Stitch is a plugin for exporting icon sets as SVG sprites. It optimizes your icons for the web and exports them as a single file. Icon Stitch streamlines workflow by generating code for easy integration into your projects and is a time-saver tool for developers and designers who need to work with icons.


Key features:


- Create with a single click

- Optimize for performance and web

- Streamline your workflow with generated code

- Validate potential issues and resolve with ease

- Import SVG sprites to visualize file contents


The plugin contains paid features:


The free version allows you to create and export SVG sprites with up to 20 icons.

Consider upgrading to support development and lift the limit.


For technical support, feature requests, and general feedback, please create a new issue on the GitHub repository.

plugins.name: Figma to PowerFX theme converter
plugins.description:
Easily transform your Figma variables into reusable themes for Power Apps with our plugin. Figma to Power FX theme converter is a tool for Power Apps designers and developers who want to streamline their workflow and save time.


Key Features:

  1. Automated Conversion: All the variables in your Figma file are automatically translates into Power FX variables while maintaining the Figma hierarchy.
  2. Collection selection: Choose the collection you want to convert into Power FX.
  3. Color Format: Choose the color format you prefer to use between RGBA and Hexadecimal


We are continuously working on improving the plugin and plan to add new parameters for even more customization in future versions.

plugins.name: Orange Tokens: Theme & Tokens
plugins.description:
Description

Orange Tokens helps you turn any base color into a full set of tints and shades — instantly and intelligently. Now with Typography Token support, you can generate consistent, scalable color and type systems right inside Figma.


Whether you're building a new design system or scaling an existing one, Orange Tokens eliminates guesswork and manual setup — so you can focus on design, not variables.


No more manual tweaks or guesswork — Orange Tokens helps you scale your colors the smart way.


🚀 How to use

  1. Enter your base colors and name them
  2. Choose how many display/text styles you want
  3. Click “Generate Variables”
  4. Orange Tokens generates color variables and synced text styles automatically


✨ Features

  1. One-click color palette generation
  2. Auto-generated tints & shades from base colors
  3. Typography tokens + text styles generated together
  4. Organized variables with design token–friendly naming
  5. Great for theming, dark/light modes, and scalable systems
  6. Fast, clean, and easy — even at scale


⚙️ How it works

Orange Tokens uses structured algorithms to create harmonious tints, shades, and typography styles from your input. Each color or text style is mapped to a logical name and stored as a Figma variable — ready for use across your entire system.


Everything updates in a few clicks — no broken styles, no messy overrides.


💬 Feedback and feature ideas?

This is just the beginning — future updates will explore typography tokens, spacing, mode support, and more. Have an idea or request? Email me at inamdar.chinmay25@gmail.com, or leave a comment on the plugin page!
plugins.tagline: Design Token Generator for Color & Typography

plugins.name: ArcTouch Flutter Theme Generator
plugins.description:
Generate Text Styles

Automatically creates a TextStyleTheme class based on all text styles in your Figma project. This class extends ThemeExtension, allowing seamless integration into your Flutter theme.


Generate Theme

Generates a ColorTheme for each variable collection in your project. Each collection is converted into a ThemeExtension to be used within your Flutter theme. If multiple collections lead to class name conflicts, you can easily rename them in your project.


Generate Color Styles

Creates a const class containing color definitions. This is ideal for projects without design tokens or those that don’t require color variations, providing simple, static color constants.


Generate Design Tokens

Creates const classes for design tokens such as spacings, paddings, and borders.



----------

plugins.name: Вотермарки MR7
plugins.description:
Этот плагин работает только внутри одноименного дизайн-файла.


Здесь вы можете без боли ставить водяные метки на фото - просто перетащите на канву набор фотографий с компьютера, запустите плагин, выберите опции для расположения логотипа и нажмите "Добавить метки". Как только изображения появятся на экране, нажмите Export в правой панели, выберите 1x PNG, затем Export layers.


Для тех, кто случайно попал сюда:


Этот плагин был разработан для петербургского СМИ и не адаптировался для универсального использования.


Если ваш сценарий использования подходит под этот плагин, вы можете его использовать со своими логотипами. Для этого вам нужно:


  1. Перейти в дизайн-файл по ссылке выше
  2. Разблокировать слой под названием mr7 в секции "Логотип"
  3. Заменить содержимое компонент на свой логотип (желательно в векторном формате) - доступно для использования две версии: в данном случае используются обычная и темная, но можно ставить любые
  4. Запустить плагин и притвориться, что логотипы в интерфейсе соответствуют вашим


Формат изображения "Галерея" масштабирует фото до 2160*1440px, а формат "Обложка" - до 2560*1440px. Нет, пока размер поменять нельзя - он указан в коде. Я планирую адаптировать плагин для универсального использования в будущих версиях.


Если у вас есть вопросы или вы хотите что-то похожее, напишите мне на m.a.zamyatin@gmail.com.
plugins.tagline: Ставим плашечки без боли и мучений

plugins.name: Better Title Case
plugins.description:
Not a fan of built-in Figma's title case? Better Title Case got your back!


  1. Select a frame or a group to apply Better Title Case to all text layers inside
  2. Or directly select one or several text layers to apply Better Title Case only to these layers


Safe to use on text layers that have several styles/properties applied to them — plugin will not remove bold or underlined text from your layers.


Current Capitalization Rules:

  1. UPPERCASE words are not processed, so AAPL or MBA will stay as is.
  2. The first and the last word in a sentence are always processed.
  3. There is a custom list of words that shouldn’t be in converted to Title Case: and, as, but, for, if, nor, or, so, yet, a, an, the, as, at, by, for, in, of, off, on, per, to, up, via, vs, v, (vs.) (v.)
  4. Word after em dash and slash processed even if it's a minor word.


If you have any feedback or ideas on improving the plugin — feel free to reach out via email or in comment section 😉.
plugins.tagline: Title Case Plugin We All Deserve

plugins.name: Table flipper
plugins.description:
Hey :)

This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.

If the table is an instance, it will detach it.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Watch demo.

Support my work here <3


How to use:

  1. Select a frame that contains only a table
  2. Select the flip direction


Important notes:

Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:

  1. Same amount of cells in all columns
  2. Same amount of cells in all rows
  3. Same width to all cells in row/column

Otherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.


How it works behind the scenes:

I calculate how many cells the table has by:

  1. How many rows/columns
  2. How many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).
  3. I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)


Enjoy :)


(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)
plugins.tagline: Flip table's layout direction from rows to columns / columns to rows
